Mike had never been what you called a big guy. Hell, he was never even called average either. No, he was always the shortest, most underdeveloped kid in school. Even the girls were taller and stronger than he was! As it wasn't enough he got pushed around by those muscle-headed jocks, but there were girls that picked on him too! But at only 5'3" and 95 lbs. wet, Mike was easy pickings.

It was another day of school, or as he liked to call it, another day of torture. Mike was struggling to carry his load of books to class when all of a sudden he felt his whole body tingle, like he had been hit by a static shock. At the same moment Brett, once of the hug football players decided to purposely bump into him, scattering all of his books.

"Watch where you're going wimp." Brett laughed and danced away to laugh some more with his friends.

Letting out a frustrated sigh, Mike began to pick up his books off the floor. "I wish I could have his muscles, then I'd teach HIM a lesson!"

Daira considered how he would approach his new avatar, but in the end he decided to stay silent for meanwhile. Perhaps after seeing some of the results the human boy would be more accepting to a supernatural being. Without Mike even realizing it, Daira possessed the skinny nerd, housing himself in the frail body of a high school student. For a brief moment Daira cringed. Here he was, the god of power reduced to hiding inside of a weakling. Well if this boy was going to be his new vessel, he needed to make him more appropriate.

Pushing his powers as far as he could go, he created an invisible, undetectable aura around Mike. Now, any man who was within a 10 foot radius Mike would very slowly, but surely, transfer their size and strength to Mike. It was very weak for now, but after he regains more power he would be able to increase it's potency.

After collecting his belongings, Mike sighed as he went to his next class. As luck would have it, he sat near the center of the classroom, giving him optimal coverage to the range of his new power. To make it even better, a good majority of the people in the classroom were guys, and a good amount of those guys were jocks of some sort, plenty of muscle to spare.

And then class started.

114.content:
"You can..." came the low, subtle voice.

Mike looked around, wondering who'd just spoken. It was almost as if someone was replying to Mike's unspoken wish.

"You can't see me," the voice continued. It sounded amused, but a little exasperated too. And perhaps on edge, just a bit?

"Who--, who are you?" Mike asked. Around him, there were giggles, as classmates saw the weird little nerd talking to his imaginary friend.

Daira needed to get the situation under control. "I am the great god Daira, lord of power and conquest. And I have chosen you, Michael."

This time, Mike thought his words, rather than speaking them aloud. "Daira? I've never heard of you before. And I've read a lot of mythology..." Mike looked around suspiciously, wondering if this was yet another prank at his expense.

The roar in his mind set things straight. "I am the god Daira! I have come to offer you the power that you crave! But if you prefer, I will find another!" The fading god was truly enraged, but bluffing as well. He'd already used so much energy to contact Mike, there wasn't enough left to find another candidate. Luckily, Mike was suitably cowed and impressed.

"What do you mean?" Mike asked, his lips moving wordlessly, as he thought the question at the voice... Daira, he supposed it was.

The dying god appreciated the shift in Mike's attitude, but time was short.

"Become mine, Michael," Daira intoned into Mike's mind. "Become my servant, my follower, my champion. And you will be rewarded. I will give you power. The power to take what you want from Brett and his kind. The power to take their strength, their size, their virility, and claim it as your own! Michael, will you conquer them in my name?"

Mike's heart skipped a beat. But he hesitated no longer than that. "Yes!" he replied, forgetting to stay silent, fellow students looking at him due to his outburst. Mike hardly noticed their stares, or the snide comments that followed. Mike was too overwhelmed, as the tingle returned, like before but much, much stronger. His books tumbled to the ground as he went stiff, oblivious to the gasps, giggles, and nasty comments around him. Daira's entry was exciting and intoxicating all at once, as the ancient deity entered his willing host.

"My power is now in you," came Daira's voice, much fainter than before, the last bits of the old, dark god much weakened by the effort of joining with Mike. "Touch a man, focus on his attributes, and call upon me. What is his will be yours, for the taking! The conquering! Do it in my name, and when you are strong enough, proclaim that it was Daira who gave you this power!"

They all knelt in a giant semi-circle with her at the center and she just slowly rose to the sky, flying, and as she rose a light coming from top of her vision started blinding her, the light was accompanied by a screeching sound which kept getting worse with the light. It ended with the light turning into pure blackness and the screeching escalating into a thunderous crash.

It woke her up in shock but as she fell back into sleep these kind of visions of wars and fights and rituals kept recurring. Dreams are weird but it was the vividness and the complete randomness of it that is stopping her from letting it slip. Normally her dreams had some people she knew from real life in it and were centered on stuff that she knew about. Barbarians bashing each other’s skulls out and then calling her “Da-rr—somin” was just well beyond even dream weird, especially since it seemed to be the only show that was being played on the dream theater.

Suddenly she received a sharp pain in the ear, “ah!” she turned her head slightly until a green and white sports jacket started entering her peripheral vision “AAaahhHHWWWWehh.. thank you DARLING!” she acted, nonchalantly returning her attention to the book. The Flick to the ear had come from Andrew, her boyfriend. Andrew put his head forward and looked into the locker,
“Calculus? Yeah it makes me depressed to” he said sardonically, kissing her on the temple as he was pulling his head back,
“No it just reminded me of something” she replied whilst still failing to give him the attention he thought he deserved. Not even really acknowledging the kiss.

“Everything ok with you?”, “classes, cheering, family… me?... or well us? What’s the matter babe?” His tone sharply changes to sympathetic, trying to get her to open up.

“Didn’t sleep well last night, when I am tired I get like this” She had ditched the dream for now

“When you don’t sleep well you catch the T virus?”

“What?”

“You were a zombie! I walked all the way down the hall, it’s like a mile long, waving my arms and shouting your name as if I was drowning and you just stood there drooling”

“I wasn’t drooling!” wiping her lips just in case “I wasn’t drooling!

“just kidding, but you might as well have been” he grabbed her book from the locker and slowly moved it down into her hands while saying in a hushed patronizing voice “we need to go or we are going to be late”

“for what?”

“Maaaaaattttthhh” Pointing at the book in a very exasperated tone, although still patronizing and getting some humor out of how airheaded his girlfriend was this morning

“I was just back from... oh Christ I just got here; it isn’t even 8:30 yet!” She said moaning, evidently really frustrated with herself but at least moving back into the land of the living.

She held her book with both hands close to her, put on a frown and gently fell onto Andrew's shoulder. Andrew, an expert by now, leaned back against her, put his arm around her back, clutching onto her arm on the far side, wrested his cheek on the top of her head whilst pulling her in tight, all in a very automaton simultaneous manner. He then slowly guided her down the halls.
“Don’t worry about it; it happens to everyone now and again. Just strange seeing it happening to you, you’re typically very aware. Did you eat something this morning?”

“Yeah think so”

Think so?” he worriedly said

“Yeah, yeah I did, it was just last night

“what happened?”

“Fall asleep, wake up, fall asleep, wake up.. was lucky if I got in 20minutes straight” She didn’t care to mention the dreams that kept waking her up. Andrew would just see it as something to poke fun of and she would be embarrassed to try and explain what they were like with the seriousness she felt they warranted.

“I hate when that happens, are you sick then?”

“not at all, well not that I know of”

“if it happens tonight you should get it checked out” Andrew let the epiphany that hit his head spread all over his face. “Probably will happen tonight?”

She seen a stupid baby like grin cross his face, “Why?” she said sternly

“You, me, up all night, tonight?” proud of himself he nodded his forehead in her direction, as if to throw the ball over the net, hoping on a rebound.

“no not all night, school again tomorrow, but definitely some of tonight. My place again, dad still not back for like a week, at least” She seemed far less gloomy now. “I will definitely be free from 7:00 onwards”

You open your door to a know to find Brady, your next door neighbor. While neighbors, you'd never been that close. You'd invited him over for the occasional beer, but he normally didn't partake. His busy schedule as a personal trainer kept him away from the house. He never came over on his own. You always had to invite him over. So his arrival truly peaked your interest.

"Hey Brady", you say as you open the door. You notice he's just in a pair of tight running shorts, made from the thinnest Lycra you have ever seen. He's sweating from head to toe and you assume he's been working out. His muscles are larger than you remember from earlier this summer when you caught a glimpse of him working in his backyard.

"Hey." he says a bit sheepishly. "I hate to bother you, but I was working out in my garage, and I locked myself out of the house. My keys, phone, wallet, everything in the house. I'm not really dressed to go anywhere to try to get some help. Any chance I can borrow your phone to call a locksmith?"

"No problem, come on in." you respond in a voice that cracks a little. "Can I get you a glass of water or something? Phones right over there." as you point to the phone sitting on the end table next to the couch.

"I'm a little embarrassed to show up like this," he says as he looks down towards his drenched skintight shorts. "Thanks for the phone, think I'll pass on the water, but you're always offering me a beer, and that might put me a bit more at ease."

"No problem." you state as you leave to get the beer. When you return you notice that Brady is just staring at the phone. "What's wrong?" you ask.

"Nothing. Locksmith can't come out until Tuesday. What am I gonna do for 4 freaking days?" as he puts his head down into his palms.

"He looked at her and smiled before saying "You could have taken more" and vanished. Lisa quickly backed out and got on the road. She sped home and quickly ran to her room. Luckily nobody was home. Once in her room she ripped the sweat shirt off and yanked the boots off. She was now a true amazon. Still the words of "You could have taken more" rang through her head as she looked at her muscular reflection in the mirror. Then it clicked in her mind and she got out her baggy winter clothes.
1551312.title: She steals muscles from 2 guys in the parking lot.

choices: A few massive guys are at the gym
15513121.content:
Lisa thought about what to do now the she understood what the words "You could always take more" meant. She came very close to jumping in her jeep and heading out to some high schools to have a Line Backer buffet but decided against it. For starters people would most likely see unlike earlier today with Jake and Todd. The next thing was the fact that she had cash but no clothes outside of some winter clothes that fit. So with that double logic Lisa headed out on her jeep towards the mall. She needed new clothes as a few winter outifts was not a wardrobe.

As she was driving she heard the voice again but this time it told her "You do not have to take more. You can take only strength if you desire as well." Lisa quickly connected the dots. She finished her drive to the mall and decided that to the extent possible everyone at the mall would help her. As she went shopping she drained a little strength from everyone who got within 10 feet of her. Lisa struggled to contain limiting herself to cocktails as she put it but she figured the math was simple. 500 people times taking 2 LBS from the bench press equaled half a ton at the bench for her. Besides she had clothes shopping to do. After hitting up several athletic stores for a few new workout clothes Lisa left. She did not want to spend all of her money when she knew she was a growing a girl who was only going to get stronger and bigger. With that she sped to her gym.

155321.content:
Cassandra "Cass" Kaplan

         Cass, appearance wise, is a fairly standard, green scalie girl. Like real lizards, she doesn't have any hair. Unlike real lizards, she has a modest bust size, roughly in the C-cup range. Her build is very average, she's not horribly unhealthy, but she could stand to lose a few pounds. She stands at about 5'5", and is 19 years old.

         Cass is a very shy girl. She keeps herself covered up with a sweatshirt or hoodie, she stays in her dorm at college a lot of the time, and has found it much easier to browse the internet, watch TV, and play video games than to go out and socialize. She is, however, hoping that sooner or later she will find the spark of... either inspiration or confidence... that could get her out into the public more. But in the mean time, she just has not found the motivation. But it seems that she may get her wish sooner than she thought, in a way she never would have expected.
155321.title: "Cass" The Dorky Lizard girl

choices: "What did you just do to me?"
1553211.content:
Cass was sitting alone in her dorm room, trying to catch up on a reading assignment. Eventually, the door opened and entered her roommate, a human girl named Melanie. (Cass's grandparents made a point of commenting how progressive it was for the college to have co-species housing)

Melanie was largely a good roommate, she was alike in personality with Cass, although a fair bit more outgoing, and they got along quite well. She did, however, have a tendency to smoke in the dorm room. Cass had asked her if she could stop towards the beginning of the year, to which she gave a brief "I'm trying to quit, don't worry", and didn't pay it any more mind. Four months later, she still smokes in the room nearly every day, and Cass, not being comfortable with confrontation, never told her a second time to take it out of the room.

As Melanie entered the room, she called out to Cass. "Hey, buddy, someone left you a box at the door. I don't know what it is." She handed her a small, cardboard box with a sticky note that read "Cassandra Kaplan"
Cass grabbed the box. "That's weird. I wasn't expecting a package, and I don't know why they didn't just deliver it in my mailbox..." she opened the box, "...what the fuck is this?"
Cass lifted out of the box a red amulet, equal parts shimmering with glory and appearing pitifully cheap. It was a very simple design, a simple diamond shape attached to a silver string necklace. It didn't look particularly mystical or ancient, the only thing about it that seemed higher than costume store quality was the rather impressive material. It looked close to the real thing, but Cass could tell by how light it was that it wasn't actually a real gemstone. But whatever it was, it wasn't plastic.

"Oooooooh!" Melanie cheered, "Looks like my girl has a secret admirer!"

Cass looks back at Melanie, "I have no idea what this is about. It looks like someone took a dollar store necklace and made a version of it that's slightly less shit."

"The worst kind! You have a poor secret admirer!"

"Maybe that's why they're a secret," Cass joked. In doing so, she once again glances at Melanie, who she now saw was once again lighting up a cigarette in the dorm. She sighed, picked herself up, and began heading for the door, spouting the first excuse she could think of: "I'm gonna go try and find something to eat. See you soon."

Melanie lowered her lighter for a moment, "Put the necklace on! See who reacts! That's your man!" Cass rolled her eyes and headed out the door.

She took another quick look at her amulet, and thought "what the hell, why not?" and put it around her neck.

***

Cassandra sat in the campus center staring at her phone. She wasn't hungry at all, she just needed to get away from the smell of her roommate's nicotine addiction. She lamented that she had not brought her textbook with her, it was awfully stupid and inconvenient of her to distance herself from her school work when she needed to be working on it most. As she lamented her poor judgement, someone caught the corner of her eye. A blue lizard fellow named Kent.

Kent had been Cass's high school ex. He stood a fair chunk higher than her, at 5'10". They broke up the summer before they went to college. It was largely a mutual agreement between the two of them, sort of the typical "this isn't working" type situation. Kent, however, never completely got over the breakup. He had been trying to get back with her and flirt a little on-and-off since they separated, and he appeared to have been trying to bulk up more in order to impress her (it did not work) putting him in reasonably above average physical condition for a young man his age.

As he approached Cass, giving a sly, awkward wave, she had a brief moment of concern that he was the one that gave her the amulet. And if he gave her that $3 dollar necklace as his ultimate "can we get back together?" present, that would simply be the height of his comic desperation. Kent finally stepped just in front of Cass's seat and asked her question #1: "Hey... uh... Cass... how's life been treating you lately?"

"Honestly, like shit." She replied, not looking up from her phone.

"Yeah, that's- uh..."

"Go ahead," she added, "let's just cut right to the chase. Ask the question."

Kent nervously pouted his head towards the ground-
"...Are you seeing anyone?"
" -Am I seeing anyone?" They said in unison.

Cass finally looked up at Kent. "Yeah, no. Does not mean I'm gonna start dating you again."

Kent desperately tried to salvage the situation, "Come, you gotta at least admit that even in this there's some synergy between us."

Cass snorted. "There's synergy because I've had to memorize this over the 30 goddamn times you've tried this in the past year and a half. It's like I'm memorizing lines like a fuckin' cashier." She stammered for a moment before shifting point, "And... did you do this? Like, legit, were you the one that gave me this?" She said pointing at the amulet.

Kent put his hands up. "No. Like literally, no. I just thought you were wearing that, I di- I didn't even really notice it until you just pointed it out..." His tone quickly shifted, "Wait so then who did give it to you?"

"Are you serious? I just told you I don't know. Neither of us even know who this guy is and you're already defensive about it. You see my problem, here?"

Kent lost eye contact and began pacing around, "I was not being defensive! I was ju-"

Cass immediately stood up in protest, vainly attempting to get eye level with him- "No, yeah, you were. Your mind heard there might be another guy in the picture, and you got scared that you wouldn't have easy access anymore." Cass, at this point takes a deep breath, puts her hand on Kent's shoulder, and closes her eyes. "Just. Fucking. Move on with your life. Flirt with someone other than me... I'm- I'm sorry I blew up on you like that, but I'm really sick of having this conversation with you all the time. Find another girlfriend. Trust me, there's a lot of girls who'd be down for a guy like you, but right now- I'm just not one of them."

As Cass finished her lecture she opened her eyes... immediately shocked to see that Kent was perfectly eye level with her. Looking down, she also noticed that he seemed to have gotten significantly skinnier, not malnourished, but much closer to what he looked like when she first met him. Upon seeing this image, Cass jumps back in bewilderment.
"Oh my god! Are you okay?!?"

Kent looks down and says-
1553211.title: Cass finds a magic amulet

choices: This amulet is evil- It needs to come off!
Maybe it would be okay to use sparingly...
This is a very exciting opportunity. Time to go nuts.
15532112.content:
"...I'm fine. Why?"

Cass took a long, concentrated look at Kent to make sure she wasn't imagining anything. No, he was definitely smaller. "Are you sure?... I mean, like... physically."

Kent, still confused, replied, "Why wouldn't I be? Did you accidentally cut me with your claws or something?"

Cass, in a desperate hope to get Kent to wake up to reality, adds this: "You look... um... frail?"

Kent's expression shifts from confusion to disgusted disappointment. "...Dude... fuck off. I get that you're mad at me, but you're really just gonna make fun of the fact that you're stronger than me out of the blue? Like that? Are you just trying to piss me off so I leave you alone?"
It was at this moment that Cass knew something very, very strange was happening. She apologized grabbed her phone, and promptly ran into the restroom as Kent stood there attempting to process what social interaction he was just exposed to.


Cass bolted into the bathroom, and took a long, hard look at herself in the mirror in hopes to collect her thoughts.
How did that even happen? Did that have anything to do with the amulet? Is it magic? Why would it make him shorter and wimpier? Why does he not remember being bigger and stronger? What exactly did he mean by "you're stronger than me"?... As she slowed herself down, Cass realized there might be an answer to that last question. She could visibly see that she did a better job of filling out her loose Pokemon hoodie... but her pants didn't feel much tighter... unless...
She checked the tag on her jeans. She was still a size 7, but it was a looser type than her old pants. She definitely didn't change into a different pair of pants mid-conversation. At last, she decides to rip the band-aid off and see the inevitable. She pulls herself out of her hoodie and witnesses herself, but visibly more muscular than before- specifically, about as strong as Kent was a moment ago. She had gained maybe a good couple inches onto her bicep... she now had visible definition... and even a faint -but certainly visible- set of abs. She did a quick flex in the mirror as she tried to fully wrap her mind around what was happening.

The amulet certainly had made Kent shorter and weaker- but it put it all back into her. She now had officially reaped the rewards of Kent's ex-chasing, even making her a bit taller as well. 5'7", maybe 5'8", and most importantly... he doesn't remember any of it! As far as he, and everyone else in the world (except Cass) is concerned... he was always like this.

Cass hurriedly puts her hoodie back on as she determines her next move.
15532112.title: "...I'm fine. Why?"

choices: Steal it all and get it over with- (fast)
155321121.content:
Cass took a good, long, hard look at herself in the mirror. Certainly, not all of her was upset by this. She had been wanting to get in better shape... and there definitely was a... nice feeling that came with the added bulk. Maybe it would be okay if- No! she thought, I'm putting that out of my mind! That isn't me, that's this evil, crazy... magic... bullshit... amulet. I'm not even gonna let it tempt me, I'm taking it off right now!

To the surprise of absolutely no-one reading this, the amulet is not going to come off so easily.
As she attempts to pull the jewel off of her neck, she notices something is keeping it in place. It's certainly not glued onto it, but it seems to be held onto her with some sort of a magnetic tether. It feels as though, with enough force, she could pull it off. But she just doesn't have what it takes at the moment.

It's at this moment that it hits her: If I want to take this necklace off... I'm going to have to be strong enough to force it off. And if I want to be strong enough to do that... I'm going to have to go steal a lot more muscle than this.

Cass's stomach churned as she tried to assess her options.

She could try as hard as possible to avoid taking any more muscle from anyone... though that would also demand she not touch another person for as long as she lives. Sooner or later, she's going to slip up. They won't realize it... but she will... and she's not sure if she's ready to live with that.

Alternatively, she could go the opposite route- Steal as much muscle as possible from several people across town until she can take the necklace off. It might be rough on her psyche, but it would get the situation over with quickly.

But the last option, loathsome as she was to admit it... was the most tantalizing to her. She would steal muscle from plenty of people- deliberately, at that... but she would take her time to enjoy the growth process. It would be giving into her carnal desires... but after all, this is A: something she has to go through whether she likes it or not, and B: a change to reality, so no-one would ever be the wiser. In the end... it's really not all that different from the other two options. But... she was still hesitant.
155321121.title: This amulet is evil- It needs to come off!
